content.description:
Fun start requiring some "Pulling", to much easier section for a few moves, to a forced, contrived move away from the natural line.

All in all a short and fun little route worth a shot if you're in the area.
content.protection: Four bolts, no anchors. A couple of small cracks allow for small gear to be placed as an anchor. Relatively easy walkoff (Unless you get vertigo) involving a short leap.
content.location: If facing "Jugs Over the Sand", it is around the right corner and back a little way. Easy to spot.

content.description: This is a sport bolted face climb with a unique fun start and a cool crux in the middle. This route has good rock quality. A few flakes seem thin but are quite secure.
content.location: This route is located on the left side of a rock formation resembling the "loose lady" formation in JTNP. This formation is located behind the main "jugs over the sand" clump. There are currently 2 routes located on this formation. The rightmost route is 5.6 this is the leftmost route. The route is noticeable by its start. It has a very thin face but a boulder leaning next to it you can use for the start

content.description: This route follows crimps and tiny edges up the left side of the face. Sustained but has 2 distinct sections that are tricky.
content.protection: TR. Climb the 5.6 to the left to reach 2 bolt anchor/chains.
content.location: This wall is located far up the jugs over the sand gully to the right,Start on the life side of the face where a big hole in the wall is.

content.description: Climb a seam up to a cruxy move where the holds disappear. After climbing the crux continue face climbing straight up.
content.protection: TR. Lead the 5.6 to the left use 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This route is located on the same wall to the right of "consummation"
